item.title: Problem Solved- Chlorinator Feed Rate Problem - Wastewater Math
item.description: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Lx7Tlniv3zY American Water College Published on Mar 26, 2012 http://americanwatercollege.org This question comes from the California Wastewater grade 3 certification exam sample questions that can be found here: http://www.swrcb.ca.gov/water_issues/... The problem reads: In an attempt to correct a filamentous growth in an activated sludge process, you want to inject chlorine into the RAS flow stream at the dosage of 2.5 pounds of chlorine per 1000 pounds of return activated sludge suspended solids.
